resources.string: <pumped>Oh, what a bonza <birthday> gift!
<yes>You’re too good to me <PlayerName>.
<glee>Thank you!
<glee>You bloody beauty!
Thanks a bunch, <petName>.
You always pull through!
<no>First <NPCName> cooks the best snag I’ve ever had.
<shock>And she has the nerve to say there is still a surprise tonight?
<no>You know what, if I didn’t love that woman…
Oh, hi there <petName>.
I’m really looking forward to a <IslandDay> snag.
<yes>I reckon <NPCName> knows what she’s doing.
<haha>But between you and me, it’s taking a lot of willpower to not snatch those tongs out of her hands.
All those colours…
<thinking>Do you reckon the sky can taste them?
<yes>I hope they taste good.
<haha>Because they look like they do!
<boohoo>I’m tempted to hang up me apron.
<no><NPCName> is an amazing cook.
<shy>I can’t believe she made everyone their own custom <Snag>.
She really knows everyone here on <IslandName>.
<yes>I reckon she's having the best day of her life.
Happy <IslandDay>, mate.
Oh, you don't have any bugs after all?
<boohoo>Why did you trick me...
Oh, you don't have anything tasty to sell?
<no>No worries, mate.
I’d love to talk, <petName>, but it’s been all go today.
<no>I’ve been flat out like a <animalName> swimming!
<IslandName> is the only place I’ve seen anything grow in a long while.
<yes>What a great place for finding fresh ingredients.
<shy>I’m bonza at cooking, but there’s only so much you can do with <BlobFish>.
<proud>I won’t stand for any trouble at my place.
<no>First whiff of a barney, and you’ll be out on your ear!
<proud>Tell me what you’ve got at home and I reckon I can make a feast out of it.
<no>You don’t need fancy ingredients to make something special.
<haha>It sure helps though!
I heard some people eat <animalName>.
<no>They’re not for me, they’re far too tough.
<thinking>Still, anything’s better than nothing when you’re hungry, I reckon.
<yes>I think it’s great to talk about your problems.
<haha>Just not to me, <petName>.
<proud>I’ve got a business to run!
<glee>Nothing beats a true-blue sunrise, I reckon.
<yes>Best time of the day, the morning.
<proud>Everybody’s still fast asleep and you can go about your business without anybody bothering you.
<no>You’d never catch me down in the deep mines!
<shy>I wouldn’t mind the dark, but I just can’t stand bats.
<no>They’re too flappy, for a start.
Oh and that screeching? Forget it!
Back in <SouthCity>, I was expected to do nothing but cook <Blobfish> and keep my mouth shut.
<haha>Sure, I says, I can do that, when <animalName> fly mate!
Sling your hook, I says, I’m outta this dump!
Best decision I ever made, <petName>l.
<yes>I always have a nibble of everything I make.
<proud>Quality control, yeah?
<shy>Of course, sometimes I have too many nibbles and there’s none left for the customers!
<haha>Especially on Sundays, mind.
<glee>Sunday is treat day.
<no>I swear, some people would just sit around all flaming day if they had the chance.
<no>Staying cooped up every day is no good for you.
<thinking>You’ve got to be kind to your body if you want it to last.
<pumped>Take it out for walks! Go for a swim!
<yes>Anything is better than nothing, I reckon.
<thinking>Make sure you’re getting your blood pumping at least thirty minutes a day.
<yes>Out there in the real world, I mean.
<haha>You don’t want your heart getting lazy, you’ll probably need it later!
Still gallivanting around all over town, are you?
<sigh>I’d join you if I wasn’t so busy at work.
<proud>There’s nothing like fresh air to keep your ticker ticking.
<yes>Remember to take regular breaks, <petName>.
<yes>A good meal is something you really want to take your time with.
<proud>My stuff’s for savouring.
<shock>Some people out there just put the food up to their mouths and are finished in three bites!
How crazy is that?
<no>Within a second there’s nothing left but quickly vanishing crumbs!
<no>Unbelievable!
I think it’s bonza we were given this chance to start again.
<shy>It takes a brave soul to pack everything up and move on, if I do say so myself.
I think this place is shaping up wonderfully though, <petName>.
I don’t need somebody else to do everything for me.
<yes>You can always rely on yourself, I reckon.
Oh sure, <PlayerName>, you might fetch me a few things here and there.
And you might have helped build my shop.
<proud>But everything else was good old fashioned <myName>!
Nothing better than some <itemName>to get you going, huh?
Reckon beans are hard to catch?
I’ve only had one and I’m bouncing off the walls!
<thinking>A lot of people don’t put much thought into what they’re having for tea.
<no>Shame for them I reckon.
<glee>A tough day can fly by knowing a healthy home cooked feed is waiting at the end of it.
Just because you like everything on the menu doesn’t mean you need to order it all at once, <petName>.
<haha>You can always come back!
<yes>I’ll try anything once, me.
<no>Oh, there’s stuff I’d probably never eat again though.
<proud>That’s what life’s for, I reckon. Trying things.
<haha>I’m here for a good time, not a long time!
<proud>You’ll never catch me behind a desk, that’s for sure.
<no>Day in day out watching the clock, growing old miserably.
<shy>I guess I don’t need to tell you though!
I see you with your little legs always running all over the place.
<yes>Always scurrying around here and there, foraging and thwacking things.
<haha>Good work, <PlayerName>!
<thinking>I’ve always been the busy type. I just like working, I think.
<pumped>Getting. Stuff. Done.
<no>There wasn’t much work in <SouthCity>, or at least, none that mattered to anybody.
<no>Never made a difference.
<yes>I feel like I’m doing that now though, <petName>.
We’re making a difference here, eh?
You can have all the planning and preparation in the world.
<pumped>But sooner or later you’ve got to actually knuckle down and get things done.
That’s what I like about you, <PlayerName>.
You get stuff done.
It’s all well and good being a little harsh at times.
<yes>Tough love, they call it.
<no>There’s no point being mean just for the sake of it though, and you’ve gotta expect a little back.
<proud>I says, don’t be afraid of speaking your mind, but don’t be surprised when somebody doesn’t wanna hear it either.
<no>You don’t have to love what you do for a living, we’re all just trying to get by.
<yes>You should absolutely find something you love doing though.
<shy>Something you can put your whole heart and soul into, yeah?
<thinking>I reckon everybody’s passionate about something or other.
<yes>Do what you want, I reckon, as long as you’re not hurting anybody.
<haha>You gotta be you!
I tell you, ever since I’ve been here, it’s like a fog’s been lifted.
<proud>I’m making some of the best feeds I reckon I ever have.
<yes>It’s definitely easier when you’ve got ingredients to work with!
You know, you’re probably my favourite customer.
You don’t say much, you always pay your bills, and you’re always ready to lend an ear.
I reckon we mate a cracking great team, <petName>.
I used to hear stories when I was little about what the world outside was like.
<shy>Before Everything Went South, I mean.
<no>I don’t think I ever paid too much attention at first.
I figured they were just stories to pass the time.
<yes>Turns out most of them were right, the good and the bad.
I guess you can’t have one without the other, right, <petName>?
Sure, you could make what I sell yourself.
You’d have to wait all year, mind.
It might even taste similar, if you’re lucky.
<no>It’s never going to be the same though.
<pumped>The stuff I sell is made with blood, sweat and tears.
<proud>That’s the <myName> guarantee, <petName>!
It’s been absolutely chockers at my place lately.
<glee>I can’t thank you enough for letting me liven <IslandName> up!
Thanks again <PlayerName>!
<no>Big city folk just don’t get it, I reckon.
They’ve got their steel, their concrete, their paperwork… and that’s it!
<shy>You’ve gotta make time for your friends, yeah?
<yes>They’re the ones that’ll pull you out of the muck, or listen when you need a good whinge.
I feel like you get it, <PlayerName>, I really do.
<shy>Thanks for being there, <petName>.
<shy>I had my head in the clouds when I was younger.
<thinking>I was always dreaming of finer foods.
<no>Nothing too fancy, mind.
<pumped>Just wholesome simple tucker that could fill your belly and keep you fighting fit.
<shy>It’s easy to dream. Doesn’t cost you a <Dink>.
<proud>Putting all this together took some hard yakka though, if I say so myself.
Thanks to you, I reckon I can get you the best tucker on <IslandName>!
We’d get traders from time to time back in <SouthCity>.
Coming in on their fancy <Airships>.
<Nomads>, they called em.
It was the only time we ever saw or ate anything different.
<proud>I’ll tell you, the first time I ever ate a slice of roo meat… it was like my whole world opened up.
<pumped>So tender, so juicy. I never knew what taste even was before then!
<no>Of course, the folks in charge would always shut them down right quick, but it didn’t matter.
<pumped>I knew I needed to get out.
There’s nobody to watch your back out in the big city.
<no>If you fall down there, you’ll go right on getting trampled.
<no>Not here though, <PlayerName>.
You’d help me up, right?
<haha>Of course you would!
<pumped>Just try and trample us here, I reckon!
<angry>We’ll give them what for!
<proud>That’s mateship, that is.
You can’t always trust people, <PlayerName>, but you can always trust them to be themselves.
As long as you keep that in mind, nothing will surprise you, I reckon.
Anyway, I like you <petName>, but I’ve got work to do!
<proud>I worked hard to get where I am, I did.
<yes>There was always someone there telling me I couldn’t do it.
I didn’t have a head for business, they says.
<no>My cooking was trash, they says, blah blah blah blah.
<angry>I’d had just about enough of it, so I says, stuff that, and stuff you too!
<proud>Sooner or later you’ve got to just ignore the whingers and take charge of yourself.
You should listen, <PlayerName>, I bloody wish I did sooner!
You’re a good egg, <PlayerName>, I mean that.
<shy>I appreciate you taking the time to listen to me natter on.
<haha>Most times I’d be nattering regardless, but it’s nice to have somebody listen!
You let me know if you need anything, <petName>.
You ever wonder about all that junk buried beneath the surface?
You reckon someone left it there or what?
I like to think it was the <animalName>. Nah, hear me out!
They had all these fancy machines, yeah? All these whirring and buzzing things and what-have-you.
Well, they’ve got them all going full bull at all hours, right?
Well, <animalName> bossman is cranky now. The head <animalName> or whatever, Top Dog.
He can’t get to sleep, see, on account of all the ruckus.
So one day he says, “Oi, youse!”, he says, “Pack that in, the lot of you!”
So they do, too.
They bury heaps of it, they do. So’s they can focus on all the regular important <animalName> stuff.
Like, um, burying and sniffing and running and all that malarky.
<yes>That’s my theory anyway.
<no>I’d like to say I was great at rustling up tucker straight from the word Go, but that wouldn’t be true.
<shy>Nah mate, I burned more than a few <itemName> to get here, I did.
<pumped>Ate every single one of them too! Builds character.
Only way to learn, I reckon.
<pumped>Not just pies either!
<shy>Nah, I burnt a salad first time I tried it!
<haha>Memories.
<glee>WOW!
Look at all these really, really cute bugs!
Can I buy them for <$>?
Sell!
No thanks
Thanks <PlayerName>!
<no>Oh...
<boohoo>Why did you trick me...
<thinking>Hmmm.
Some great produce here, <PlayerName>.
How does <$> sound?
Sell!
No thanks
Pleasure doing business, <PlayerName>!
<no>I'll give these tasty items back to you then.
All right... Lets see...
It seems these items aren't worth anything, but I can still take them off your hands if you don't want them?
Yes, I dont want them.
I'll have them back thanks.
Righto, mate.
Cheers.
That's fine, please return if you wish to sell anything else.
All right... Lets see...
It seems these items aren't worth anything, but I can still take them off your hands if you don't want them?
Yes, I dont want them.
I'll have them back thanks.
Righto, mate.
Cheers.
That's fine, please return if you wish to sell anything else.
Thank you for visiting John's Goods!
You know what, <petName>?
<yes>Flying this <Kite> is a bit like heating up a pan.
<thinking>And hitting the <PaperLanterns> is like adding some nice veggies to the pan.
And exchanging the <itemName> for prizes?
<haha>Well, that’s nothing like cooking at all!
Howdy, <petName>.
Ready for the <SkyFest> festivities today?
You know what?
<yes>I’ve had a wonderful day today, <petName>.
<thinking>And this <Aurora> is a great way to end a great day.
<yes>Every day here on <IslandName> gets better and better.
<yes>If only making a <Kite> was more like cooking.
<shy>I mean, I aced making my <Kite> and everything.
<haha>Just prefer cooking!
<shocked>Whoa! Quite the catch!
Can I buy them for <$>?
Sell!
No thanks
Thanks <PlayerName>!
Righto, mate.
